snippet: Having the top show on television presents a rare opportunity for any network, but especially NBC, which has been so far behind for so long.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column on NBC's new reality singing competition show The Voice, which has been a break-out success, recently displacing Fox's American Idol as America's top-rated television series; holds that success presents a rare opportunity, and poses major challenges for NBC, which has been behind in the ratings race for a long time.
lead_paragraph: Having the top show on television presents a rare opportunity for any network, but especially NBC, which has been so far behind for so long.

headline.print_headline: ‘The Voice’ Shapes Up As a Winner For NBC
headline.seo: NBC Finds a Winner in ‘The Voice’
headline.main: NBC Finds a Winner in ‘The Voice’
